title: UDL-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Addressing Diversity in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience, with foundational knowledge in language education
context.additional_context: Practical understanding of online learning design for professional learners (beginners in medical/legal/technical fields) with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds in offline settings

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three UDL principles (engagement, representation, action & expression) to online content design.
Two or more assessment rubrics reflecting diverse learner needs can be developed.
Three technical strategies for ensuring accessibility in BYOD environments can be presented.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Document

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
